paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) with variable cardiac involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (P1) presented with neuropathy at age 30 and was diagnosed with FAP at age 32.
Patient P2 developed cardiac symptoms at age 40 and was diagnosed at age 42.
Patient P3, although a carrier, remained asymptomatic until age 50.
P4 was diagnosed with FAP at age 58 after presenting with symptoms at age 55.

functional_data.summary: The Val40Met variant in TTR is associated with altered protein stability and amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected family members.
variants.population_frequency: The variant is found in 0.02% of the population in gnomAD.
variants.additional_notes: The Val40Met variant is one of the most studied mutations in TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The Val30Met mutation causes predominantly neuropathy, also known as familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP).
In a previous study involving patients with Val30Met FAP, differential cardiac involvement was observed.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variant was successfully extracted.
